tool.name: iCFree learner
tool.command: cp '$input_param_tsv' 'param.tsv' && mkdir 'indir' && #for $i, $input in enumerate($input_data_csv) #if $input cp '$input' 'indir/plate.${i}.csv' && #end if #end for python -m icfree.learner --data_folder 'indir' --parameter_file 'param.tsv' --output_folder 'outdir' #if str($adv.name_list) != '' --name_list '$adv.name_list' #end if #if str($adv.test) == 'true' --test #end if --nb_rep '$adv.nb_rep' #if str($adv.flatten) != '' --flatten #end if #if str($adv.seed_cond.seed_param) == 'not_random' --seed '$adv.seed_cond.seed' #end if --nb_new_data_predict '$adv.nb_new_data_predict' --nb_new_data '$adv.nb_new_data' --parameter_step '$adv.parameter_step' --n_group '$adv.n_group' --km '$adv.km' --ks '$adv.ks' --save_plot --verbose

param.name: name_list
param.label: Labels of the feature list
param.help: A comma-separated string of column names or identifiers, converted to a list of strings representing columns that contain labels (y). This separates y columns from the rest (X features). (Default: Yield1,Yield2,Yield3,Yield4,Yield5)

param.name: test
param.label: Validate the model
param.help: A flag for validating the model; not required to run inside the active learning loop. If not set, skip the validating step

param.name: nb_rep
param.label: Number of test repetitions for validation the model behavior
param.help: The number of test repetitions for validating the model behavior. 80% of data is randomly separated for training, and 20% is used for testing.

param.name: flatten
param.label: Flattent feature data
param.help: A flag to indicate whether to flatten Y data. If set, treats each repetition in the same experiment independently; multiple same X values with different y outputs are modeled. Else, calculates the average of y across repetitions and only model with y average.

param.name: nb_new_data_predict
param.label: Number of new data points generated
param.help: The number of new data points sampled from all possible cases.

param.name: nb_new_data
param.label: Number of new data points used
param.help: The number of new data points selected from the generated ones. These are the data points labeled after active learning loops. `nb_new_data_predict` must be greater than `nb_new_data` to be meaningful.

param.name: parameter_step
param.label: Step size used to decrement the maximum predefined concentration sequentially
param.help: The step size used to decrement the maximum predefined concentration sequentially. For example, if the maximum concentration is `max`, the sequence of concentrations is calculated as: `max - 1 * parameter_step`, `max - 2 * parameter_step`, `max - 3 * parameter_step`, and so on. Each concentration is a candidate for experimental testing. Smaller steps result in more possible combinations to sample.

param.name: n_group
param.label: Number of clusters
param.help: Parameter for the cluster margin algorithm, specifying the number of groups into which generated data will be clustered.

param.name: km
param.label: Number of data points for the first selection
param.help: Parameter for the cluster margin algorithm, specifying the number of data points for the first selection. Ensure `nb_new_data_predict > ks > km`.

param.name: ks
param.label: Number of data points for the second selection
param.help: Parameter for the cluster margin algorithm, specifying the number of data points for the second selection. This is also similar to `nb_new_data`.

param.name: seed_param
param.label: Seed
param.help: Choose a seed or let it as random

element.name: Yield evolution through each active learning query
Yield evolution through each active learning query

tool.help: Learner ======= Active learning and model training
